member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamPropertyGrid.FilterText
member.summary: Returns/sets a string that defines a 'contains' filter for filtering the items that are displayed in the control based on property name. The 'contains' filter that is created from this string is combined (using an 'Add' operator) with the filters (if any) specified in the property. By default this property is bound to the textbox in the filter area displayed at the top of the control.
member.remarks: Note: To perform complex filtering with multiple conditions or filtering that is evaluated against values other than property name (e.g., , , or ) use the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamPropertyGrid.IsCategorized
member.summary: Returns/sets whether the items in the are grouped by the category they belong to.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamPropertyGrid.ItemFilters
member.summary: Returns/sets the filter condition(s) that the uses when determining which s to display. The filters defined with this property are combined (using an 'Add' operator) with the 'Contains' filter created from the property (if any). The FilterText property is bound (by default) to the textbox in the displayed at the top of the XamPropertyGrid.
member.remarks:
Note: Although it is possible to use any class that derives from (e.g., the conditions supplied in the Infragistics base class library such as , and ) to set this property, the corresponding custom s supplied with the XamPropertyGrid provide more flexibility. Specifically, the , and conditions each expose an OperandSource property of type which lets you specify the value that should be used when evaluating whether a particular item satisfies the filter criteria.
If you do choose to use the standard , and conditions or even a custom condition that implements , then is used by the filter evaluation logic to determine whether a particular item matches the specified condition(s).
